page.title: 07The Church
page.content: Mr.Bowles is the rector in Brailsford. He has been the rector for six years. He has two sons and one daughter.They live in a four year old rectory but they lived in a five hundred year old rectory.The Church stands between the villages of Brailsford and Ednaston to serve the people of both villages. The Church was built in Saxon times and is thought to be about nineteen hundred years old.A yew tree by the main door is about 1000 years old.The six bells have been there as long as records have been in existance.A Saxon Cross has been found in the church-yard but the top of it has been broken off.The stained-glass windows are about 80 years old.The position of the church and its coldness due to infrequent use must contribute to falling attendances at the services.
